alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 29 at 6:21AM EDT until October 01 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, around two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, a high risk of rip currents is expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 6 AM EDT Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Friday morning through Friday afternoon. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Waves continue to build into Friday. A second round of high surf conditions is expected early next week. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/12 PM 4.2 1.4 1.0 4-5 NONE 30/12 AM 4.0 1.2 1.4 5 NONE 30/01 PM 5.3 2.5 2.1 5-6 MINOR 01/01 AM 5.2 2.4 2.7 5-6 MINOR 01/02 PM 4.5 1.7 1.4 2-3 MINOR 02/02 AM 3.7 0.9 1.3 2-3 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/11 AM 4.1 1.2 0.6 4-5 NONE 29/11 PM 3.8 0.9 1.0 5-6 NONE 30/12 PM 5.0 2.1 1.5 6-7 MINOR 01/12 AM 4.8 1.9 2.1 7 NONE 01/01 PM 4.3 1.4 0.9 4-5 NONE 02/01 AM 3.6 0.7 1.0 3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/12 PM 4.3 1.6 1.3 1 NONE 30/12 AM 4.1 1.4 1.7 1 NONE 30/01 PM 5.2 2.5 2.2 1 MODERATE 01/01 AM 5.0 2.3 2.7 1 MODERATE 01/02 PM 4.6 1.9 1.7 1 MINOR 02/02 AM 3.7 1.0 1.5 1 NONE COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/10 AM 5.2 1.5 0.9 5-6 NONE 29/11 PM 4.7 1.0 1.3 8-9 NONE 30/11 AM 6.0 2.3 1.7 7-11 MODERATE 30/11 PM 5.0 1.3 1.9 9 NONE 01/12 PM 5.0 1.3 0.8 6-7 NONE 02/12 AM 4.0 0.3 0.9 4-5 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
